Row.Text: Not through speeches will the great questions of the day be decided, but by iron and blood.
Otto von Bismarck
Endless wonder at slow waters quiet in frozen beauty and bamboo shimmering with frost.
Xie Lingyun
It is cold, but we have sake and the hot spring.
Masaoka Shiki
Just as the rain breaks through an ill-thatched house, so passion penetrates an undeveloped mind.
The Tripiṭaka
The Tower can live on itself: one can dream there, eat there, observe there, understand there; one can feel oneself cut off from the world and yet the owner of a world.
Roland Barthes
Every passion borders on the chaotic, but the collector's passion borders on the chaos of memories.
Walter Benjamin
Now, I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.
The Bhagavad Gita
Princes are like pythons. They swallow each other.
Mwanga II
I wonder anybody does anything at Oxford but dream and remember.
William Butler Yeats
Feet, what do I need them for if I have wings to fly?
Frida Kahlo
The world is the place we prove real by dying in it.
Salman Rushdie
Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free. I lift my lamp beside the golden door.
Emma Lazarus
We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love, never so helplessly unhappy as when we have lost our loved object or its love.
Sigmund Freud
Sell the cook stove if necessary and come. You must see this fair.
Harmlin Garland
